dcterms:creator: H. Yan
Z. J. Shi
J.-H. Cui
dcterms:description: DBR is the first underwater routing solution that exploits depth information of sensor nodes to forward data packets, utilizing a holding time mechanism to coordinate the transmission of forwarding candidates.
dcterms:title: DBR (Depth-Based Routing)

dcterms:creator: A. Wahid
D. Kim
dcterms:description: EEDBR extends the DBR protocol by incorporating both depth information and the residual energy of sensor nodes to select the next hop node, aiming for energy efficiency.
dcterms:title: EEDBR (Energy Efficient Depth-Based Routing)

dcterms:creator: Q. Guan
F. Ji
Y. Liu
H. Yu
W. Chen
dcterms:description: DVOR is a distance-vector-based routing protocol that uses hop counts of sensor nodes towards the destination to determine the shortest routing path, incorporating a holding time mechanism for packet forwarding.
dcterms:title: DVOR (Distance-Vector-Based Opportunistic Routing)

dcterms:creator: T. Hu
Y. Fei
dcterms:description: QELAR is a machine-learning-based adaptive routing protocol that focuses on energy efficiency and extending the lifetime of underwater sensor networks by defining a reward function based on residual energy.
dcterms:title: QELAR (Q-learning-based Adaptive Routing)
